name: Grilled Caribbean-Spiced Pork Tenderloin with Peach Salsa
author: Joan Heeg
summary: A quick and easy way to grill pork tenderloin. Coated in a Caribbean spice mixture, grilled, and served with homemade peach salsa.
ingredients: ¾ cup fresh peaches, peeled and diced
directions: Combine peaches, bell pepper, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl
Combine olive oil, brown sugar, Caribbean jerk seasoning, thyme, rosemary, and seasoned salt in a second small bowl
Rub tenderloin with the spice mixture
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate
Place tenderloin on hot grill and cook covered for 9 to 11 minutes
Turn and grill until tenderloin is slightly pink in the center, 9 to 11 minutes more
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
Remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 5 minutes before slicing
